data.title: Medical Holography
data.meta_description: RealView Imaging is pioneering the field of interactive live holography, creating a new dimension for Augmented Reality applications.
data.text:
Dr. Eckhouse is an inventor, entrepreneur and investor in the field of medical technologies. He is the Chairman of the Board of Syneron Medical Ltd. (NASDAQ: ELOS) which he co-founded in 2001 and took public in 2004. Dr. Eckhouse was also a co-founder and the Chairman of Ventor Medical Technologies Ltd. (acquired by Medtronic in 2009 for $325M). He has founded and currently chairs Alon MedTech Ventures, which is dedicated to the incubation of start-up companies and is the Chairman of the Board of several private companies, including OrSense, Calore Medical, Tulip, Rapid Medical, Opticul Diagnostic and C3D. Dr. Eckhouse holds a B.Sc. in physics from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology, and a Ph.D. in physics from the University of California at Irvine. He has more than 100 registered patents and has published more than 50 papers in leading journals and conferences. He is also a member of the Board of Directors of the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology.

Mr. Kaufman is a business executive, entrepreneur and inventor with significant experience within multinational, technology-oriented companies. For the past 9 years, he has been leading RealView Imaging’s business efforts from inception through a number of growth stages, to become the global leader in Holographic Augmented Reality. Prior to establishing RealView Imaging, Mr. Kaufman served in various business and marketing positions within Lipman Electronics, a leading global provider and manufacturer of electronic payment systems (acquired in 2006 by VeriFone, NYSE: PAY) and Rafael Defense Industries, Israel’s world-renowned defense design and development center. Mr. Kaufman earned his MBA (cum laude) from the Tel Aviv University, a B.Sc. (cum laude) in Industrial Engineering & Management from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology, and is a graduate of the US-Israel Executive Program at the Merage School of Business, California.

Mr. Gelman is a highly skilled business and R&D executive, with 17 years of hands-on experience and multiple inventions in the field of head-mounted Augmented Reality and Holographic 3D technologies. Mr. Gelman has been leading the company’s growth, technology strategy and R&D execution from invention to full productization. He is considered a world scale expert in the fields of Augmented Reality headsets, 3D data representation and natural physiological interactions with holograms. Before founding RealView Imaging, Mr. Gelman worked for Elbit Systems (NASDAQ: ESLT), Israel’s largest defense company, leading large scale R&D programs in the field of Augmented Reality Head Mounted Displays (HMDs) for pilot applications, actively used by leading Air-Forces. Mr. Gelman earned his Executive MBA (cum laude) from the Haifa University, a B.Sc. (cum laude) in Industrial Engineering (IT) from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology and is a graduate of the US-Israel Executive Program at the Merage School of Business, California.

Dr. Bruckheimer is a leading cardiologist and is the Director of the Cardiac Catheterization Laboratories at Schneider Children’s Medical Center, Israel. Dr. Bruckheimer is an expert in interventional cardiology for the treatment of congenital and structural heart disease and serves regularly on faculty at leading international meetings including TCT (Transcatheter Cardiovascular Therapeutics), PICS-AICS, CSI, ICI and the Veith symposium.

Trained as a physician in the UK, he later specialized in pediatric interventional cardiology in the US at Yale University in New Haven, Connecticut. Dr. Bruckheimer is a proven entrepreneur in the medical device industry and a leading expert on 3D cardiac imaging.

Dr. Yehudit Kraizer has a strong background in Medical Science and over 18 years of experience in the field of Medical Devices, leading both clinical and regulatory activities in various management positions. In her clinical positions she managed multi-center studies in a variety of clinical fields including peripheral arterial disease, otolaryngology surgery and endourology procedures. She also specializes in the planning and execution of regulatory strategies, working with international regulatory authorities including FDA, EU Notified Bodies and China FDA. Dr. Kraizer held a number of management positions at Lumenis, a global leader in the field of minimally-invasive clinical solutions for the Surgical, Ophthalmology & Aesthetic markets, including the Director for Global Regulatory Affairs and Clinical Research Manager. Prior to that she was the Clinical Studies Manager at Syneron Medical Ltd. (NASDAQ: ELOS) and Flowmedic Ltd. Dr. Kraizer achieved her Ph.D. in Medical Science from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology.

Dr. Laurent Verard, an experienced business development leader with 25+ years of international expertise in healthcare strategy, product development, marketing, and commercial growth, possesses in-depth technical and clinical knowledge in medical devices, equipment, and digital health innovations. Notably, he successfully introduced Europe to the first StealthStation® image-guided surgery system with Medtronic. He played a vital role in Philips' global strategy to become a leader in image-guided therapy, achieving significant milestones in interventional cardiology and oncology through strategic acquisitions and partnerships. During the digital health transformation, Dr. Verard led commercial partnerships for IBM Watson Health and Philips Connected Care, introducing AI-based cognitive SaaS solutions for patient stratification, remote monitoring, and therapy adherence management. He holds a PhD in Medical Imaging, as well as M.Sc. degrees in Medical Instrumentation and Electrical Engineering from the University of Caen, France. Additionally, he is an MBA graduate from the University of Phoenix in Denver, Colorado.

Mr. Adam Inbar manages the development of RealView Imaging’s flagship product, the HOLOSCOPE-i system, through the entire product lifecycle from proof of concept, development, regulatory clearance, introduction to the market and technical service. Mr. Inbar has over 18 years of experience managing engineering groups and development projects combining hardware, software, mechanics and electro-optics, in the medical and defense industries. His experience ranges from some of the most sophisticated technology companies in the world in electro-optical testing/measurement and head-mounted Augmented Reality systems (CI-systems, Elbit Systems (NASDAQ: ESLT)). - Manager of standard product development. He also held business management positions as the head of the European business unit at CI-systems (responsible for marketing, operations and service). Mr. Inbar holds BSc in Mechanical Engineering from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology.

Dr. Rotschild is a leading scientist, inventor and a world-renown expert in optical physics and optical engineering, with substantial industry and academic experience. For close to 20 years, Dr. Rotschild has gained meaningful hands-on experience in the design and development of highly sophisticated optical systems. He has earned both his B.Sc. in Optical Engineering and a Ph.D. in Optical Physics from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology, and has completed his post-doc at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT).

Along his academic career, he has gained some of the most prestigious awards for young researchers, such as the Fulbright Scholarship. Dr. Rotschild is currently a faculty member at the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology. In addition to his position at RealView Imaging, he also leads the Optical Engineering studies at the Mechanical Engineering department at the Technion.

Mr. Braitbart is a highly skilled optical engineer with over 17 years of hands-on experience in optical systems design in the fields of digital holography, optical communication, 3D metrology and medical applications. In addition to his profound skills with numerous optical measurement methods and techniques, Mr. Braitbart possesses extensive know-how in human 3D perception and is a major expert in digital holographic technologies and algorithms.

Mr. Braitbart has earned both his B.Sc. in Optical Engineering and M.Sc. in Solid State Physics from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology. He holds several patents in the fields of holographic technics and 3D metrology.

Mr. Gefen is a highly skilled operations manager with ~30 years of experience in a number of industries, including in leading medical companies. His expertise includes suppliers and manufacturers allocation and management, production floor design and control, ERP systems, QA processes and medical regulatory aspects. Before joining RealView Imaging, Mr. Gefen worked for Opgal Optronics, a major supplier of Electro-Optical products using thermal imaging, leading the company’s purchasing department. Prior to that, Mr. Gefen worked at InSightec for 9 years, a global medical company providing the first MR-guided focused ultrasound therapeutic system, where he lead the Supply Chain of the company for a highly sophisticated product and was also responsible for building the Operations department infrastructure.

Mr. Gefen earned his Bachelor degree from the University of Haifa and Studied for his MBA in Justus-Liebig-University Giessen. Continuing education programs include supply chain risk management, management tools, ROHS & WEEE directive and more.
